text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

The general records schedules are issued by the Archivist of the United States to provide disposition authorization for records common to several or all agencies of the federal government. They have been adopted and prescribed for use by the Internal Revenue Service. The GRS contains records that are common to most offices. They include administrative records relating to civilian personnel, fiscal accounting, procurement, communications, printing, and other common functions.
The IRM material has been moved to Document 12829, General Records Schedules published April 2010. Document 12829 consolidates the material in IRM 1.15.38 through IRM 1.15.64.
